data.text:
AND KOBE!!!

Wishful thinking but definitely possible. All we have to do is amnesty Boozer and let Deng and Heinrich walk. Then sign Kobe for the max and sign BG for about $8 million. Then sign Mitoric. Maybe even look into trading for LINSANITY!!!

ROSE/TEAGUE

KOBE/BG/SNELL

BUTLER/DUNLEVY

MITORIC/GIBSON

NOAH/WHO CARES

Boozer's OK but I'd rather have Kobe and BG. Deng's not very good and pretty overrated. BG's much better and would put us OVER THE TOP. AND KOBE'S KOBE!

And Heinrich's got to go he's worse then BROGANS!!! Shoulda kept NATE ROB TOO!!!

Bottom line is WE NEED SCORERS AND GUYS WHO CAN CLOSE OUT GAMES!!! PERIOD!!!

Lol at the mod who deleted Mr.247's post. :lol:

But Yes, i must agree with the OP that bringing back Ben Gordon could be a real possibility in the future if PaxGar miss out on the 2014 free agent class again.

Adding real consistent scoring off our bench can only be a plus.

More points cant be a bad thing, especially when having 2 guys on the floor at the same time that require double teams from opponants......Ben Gordon would add fuel to bringing down and disrupting the opposing teams defense.

Just Sayin..........

Besides, if and when Ben Gordon enters free agency, im sure we could get him at bargain prices.

His money value in free agency has dropped significantly since he joined Detroit years ago.

The Bulls brass could probably get Ben Gordon cheap...........

So why not bring him back for bench depth...?

Why not add a guy who can score off the bench?

Its not like the Bulls have any realistic,dependable scoring options off the current bench.......

Thats B.Gs specialty.

Ben could play the kind of roll Nate Robinson did for us last year coming off the bench.

When the Bulls went on major scoring droughts during games, Nate would come on the floor and score lights out instantly.

Ben can do the same thing...........

INSTANT OFFENSE is not a bad thing to have on a team............especially for a team like the roster on our current Bulls that happens to suffer from scoring droughts throughout games........

This has been an issue with the Bulls since Ben Gordon left.................................

It's been explained hundreds of times why its bad and why it won't happen and why it won't help the Bulls.

They could have had instant offense at a good bargain by just re-signing Nate, but they didn't. That right there should show you why Ben Gordon is NOT coming to the Bulls. So why do people continue, year after year to bring this up? You would think Ben Gordon is some kind of Bulls all time great the way people never shut the fuck up about him.

He hasn't played for the Bulls in years, the Bulls offered him a contract but he wanted more money (that's his prerogative, whatever) and wasted away his career in Detroit and now is wasting it away on the Bobcats. He wanted his money and got it. Everyone is happy. Why can't people just let it go?
